Classical.Structure: Anterior Cingulate Cortex. Collar-like region along the medial surface of the frontal lobes.
Classical.Function: Error detection, conflict monitoring, emotional regulation, decision-making.
Classical.Pathology: Linked to anxiety disorders, OCD, depression.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A key node in the brain's macroscopic quantum entanglement network (Salience Network). Its function is dependent on the global proton-spin entanglement (W > 1) that collapses during unconsciousness.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The seat of the 'inner critic'. The fulcrum that balances action against ideal, processing dissonance between 'what is' and 'what ought to be'.

Falsification_Hypotheses: The ACC will show no loss of its quantum entanglement signature (W > 1) during general anesthesia, even as consciousness is lost.
The function of the Salience Network will be fully describable by classical neural firing, without requiring non-local quantum correlations.
Experimental_Protocols: Advanced MQC-NMR (Kerskens, 2024) to measure the entanglement witness (W) specifically in the ACC and Insula during conflict-monitoring tasks.
